data.text: @cambionkoncept @NicolaHarvey Your ignorance is almost equal to your smug certainty. Of course we want to slow the pressure on the DHBs. If you have a heart attack or a stroke or an accident you'll be very glad if the hospital has capacity to treat you.

@NicolaHarvey @WinningV1 My experience. Don’t look to saleyards for Trust.
Get close to customers

@PaulBMcGill @WinningV1 Re this: we’re four year into farming now and building a trusted network but if one is new to it all and doesn’t know how the system works or who to trust then sale yards = access. If you’re lucky to have legacy or corp behind you, I’m sure it’s different and easier.
@PaulBMcGill @WinningV1 Sure. I don’t like to generalise typically so I could have been more specific. I’m just surrounded by this rhetoric at the mo. Glad others aren’t.
@NicolaHarvey @WinningV1 Ao saleyards might not be a good representation ‘rural NZ’ either?

@NicolaHarvey @WinningV1 Most farmers don’t sell / buy from Saleyards anymore.
Good reasons not too
@mcnaughthelen1 @NicolaHarvey Is the 24 percent actual cases reported/treated?
@NicolaHarvey Sounds like the heartland is full of effluent
@NicolaHarvey Why blame Jacinda this is a world wide pandemic and has a wide affect on everyone why don't you sell your meat to your own people at a reasonable price instead of ripping us off
